title.rendered: University of Alberta Graduate Program Admission  2024

content.rendered:
University of Alberta Graduate program Admission 2024, Choose your graduate program, Tuition Payments Deadlines, fees & cost of living Estimates.

Contents on This Page

Toggle
  • University of Alberta Graduate Program Admission 2024
  • Tuition and Fees for Graduate Programs:

This is to inform the general public that admission into the Graduate Program of the University of Alberta is open for application online. All interested students seeking to study a Post Graduate course at the University are admonished to use this opportunity to submit applications for admission considerations.

University of Alberta Graduate Program Admission 2024

The University of Alberta offers 500+ graduate programs, 250 specializations, and 300 research areas.

Before you begin, consider the following headings;

Table of Contents

How To Apply For University of Alberta Graduate Program Admission 2024

Choose Your Graduate Program

Review Graduate Admissions Requirements and Contact the Department.

Prepare and Apply Online

How to Apply for Graduate Program at the University of Alberta

Fee & Cost of Living Estimates

Tuition Payment Deadlines

Choose Your Graduate Program

List of Accommodations at the University of Alberta

How To Apply For Graduate Admission to the University of Alberta

Follow the steps below to complete your application process

Choose Your Graduate Program

Review Graduate Admissions Requirements and Contact the Department.

Students applying to any of the following undergraduate programs should also visit the Registrar’s Office to apply:
Doctor of Medicine (MD)
Doctor of Dental Surgery (DDS)
Doctor of Pharmacy (PharmD)
Juris Doctor (JD)

Prepare and Apply Online

To apply online, the following documents are required;

  • Transcripts, Degree Certificates, Marksheets,
  • CV, statement of intent, writing samples
  • GRE, GMAT, and other test scores
  • References:
    >> Will require the name of referees, title, and email addresses.
    >> An email with a secure link will only be sent to your referees after you submit and pay for your application.
    >> Reference letters need to be in PDF and must be on your referee’s institution’s or company’s official letterhead or they will not be accepted.

A $100 CAD non-refundable application fee is required. Payments can be made using a valid credit card only, we accept Visa, MasterCard, American Express, and Discover cards.

How to Apply for Graduate Program at the University of Alberta

  1. Go to https://graduate-studies-apply.ualberta.ca/urd/sits.urd/run/siw_ipp_lgn.login?process=siw_ipp_app_crss
  2. Apply by clicking Create Account Link
  3. Visit Email and confirm login details
  4. Sign in again to complete and upload supporting documents
  5. Check Application Status.

Tuition and Fees for Graduate Programs:

Fee & Cost of Living Estimates

For the sake of bringing information close to your doorsteps, we present this fee structure before applying for Post Graduate admission at the University of Alberta.

Students should consider the following Fees structures in order to determine cost estimates for any spending;

  • The Instructional fees
  • The Non-instructional fees
  • The Cost of living in Edmonton

Tuition Payment Deadlines

To avoid installment charges, all Spring/Summer fees must be paid by the Spring fee payment deadline, and all Winter/Winter fees must be paid by the last business day of January.

  • Winter 2024 – January 29, 2024
  • Spring 2024 –May 6, 2024
  • Summer 2024 – July 8, 2024

List of Accommodation in University of Alberta

  1. Lister Residence ( For year 1 students, New & Returning Students – delayed second-year residents, and Residents living in Cohorts and Lifestyle Communities)
  2. Peter Lougheed Hall (For first-year students and student leaders)
  3. Résidence Saint Jean (Les étudiants au premier cycle universitaire, majoritairement dans leur première année d’étude)
  4. Nîpisîy House (For upper-year undergraduate students; and NEW! Upper year undergraduate students in the Faculty of Engineering)
  5. Pinecrest and Tamarack House (For upper-year undergraduate students)
  6. HUB (For upper-year undergraduate and graduate students)
  7. Aspen and Maple House (For upper-year undergraduate students)
  8. Linden House (Linden House is not expected to be open for Winter 2024 and For upper-year undergraduate students)
  9. Alder House (Alder House is not expected to be open for Winter 2024, and For upper-year undergraduate students
  10. International House (For upper-year undergraduate and graduate students)
  11. Newton Place (For the third year (and up) undergraduate and graduate students, and student couples (including students who parent) in any year of study)
  12. Graduate Residence (For graduate students)
